Since this is an Apple OSX download, sitx can standard be opened on a Mac, using StuffIt Expander. When expanded, you'll find 2 .dmg files. The 1st contains all adobe software and the 2nd contains the cracks. You'll have to double-click on the dmg's, though (for dummies)
If you have trouble opening the sitx, please download the most recent version of StuffIt Expander (version 11) from http://www.stuffit.com

That's normal with cracked apps. Once the crack is applied, the app is "as is". If you want to udate to a newer version, you'll have to wait until this is published, including updated cracks.

Reloading is not necessary. Just drop the torrent in Azureus and let it check. If some parts are missing, Azureus will re-download the missing or failing parts. This will take less time than completely reloading the torrent.
I also tried it on another machine, also with CS2 installed, without any problem.

WARNING to people downloading this: This torrent contains the pre-release version of CS3, 20070222. The cracks work, but then you can't update any of the software w/ Adobe Updates. And a couple minor programs crash, e.g. VersionCue.  To get the release version (20070321), try this: http://thepiratebay.org/tor/3672354/Adobe_CS3_Design_Premium_OSX 

To find out which version you have, go to Photoshop (after its installed), do a 'Get Info' and look at the Version string.

It worked! It worked!
For the other n00bs out there, this is what I did: I ran the "Setup" program, opened InDesign, entered serial no. 1326-0110-5569-6121-4741-2255 
Then it asked me to buy an e-Licence. I quit and downloaded this: http://thepiratebay.org/tor/3656499/Adobe_Creative_Suite_CS3_Premium_Crack
Then I simply dragged the applications into the drop zone in this file and it worked perfectly!
THANK YOU SOOO MUCH TO THE UPLOADERS OF BOTH FILES!!!!

The reason why expanding is keeping you hanging up at the end is because you need to update Stuff-it Expander to  version 12 (the latest version). If you get info about the file that is expanding you will see the size of the file going up while it is expanding. If the size info is not going up, It's not working... don't waste your time close it and try the new version of stuff it expander, try again. It takes a long time to expand so be sure the file size is going up. Trial and error, that's what it's all about with computer/software problems. Took me all day to figure it out :( but happy I did :). Enjoy!
